item.title: As per 3 other reports Dec- Jan, 7th January

Same area of Honiton Garden is again fly tipped. Cllr Edwards, estate team and street clean planning to do signs, planting Pls Your team is efficient that without signs - and leaflets - resident seem to think the removal is now a standard service! Pls inform From: Mehmet, Mehmet <Mehmet.Mehmet@southwark.gov.uk And To: McCarthy, Debbie <Debbie.McCarthy@southwark.gov.uk>

item.title: Chair, huge fridge, other junk dumped from school opposite, one teacher one man work is employed by the school., 7th January
item.description:
Regular flytipping occurs from this school opposite (next to 19 margaret road). Staff instruct workman to dump stuff and school staff also dump stuff. Sometimes the entire side of building is full of pallets, school desks (old) broken chairs. I have proof!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Margaret Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain causing people to stop on a busy road, 7th January
item.description:
Blocked drain causes a puddle in the road at the entrance to the National Trust woods. People crossing the A208 from Marlings Park to enter the woods have to stop in the road (often with dogs or children) in front of traffic to jump or edge round the puddle. In the recent cold weather it was frozen and caused an additional hazard. When the drain is clear, there is only a puddle for a few hours after heavy rain. Currently, there has been a puddle there for a week or more because it has nowhere to drain away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orpington Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole repair from a week ago already failing, 7th January
item.description:
Danson underpass, southbound. Really long and deep pothole was repaired a week or so ago and is already failing. Surely this won't meet the minimum service level agreement and needs to be revisited. It's back to how it was already and poses a danger to motorcyclists travelling under the underpass. It can be difficult to spot as you come into the shadow of the underpass. Please address as a priority. A bike changing lanes could crash.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Underpass, Blendon, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The building enclosure is a danger, 7th January
item.description:
The building enclosure at the beginning of Cold Blow Crescent for the works in Baldwyns Park Road has been positioned on the double yellow lines. Some years ago our Residents Association had the yellow lines extended for safe access to the Crescent. It is now very dangerous to drive in and out of the Crescent. The road was blocked this morning by a grab lorry collecting earth. Did you know that this enclosure was going to be positioned on the yellow lines dangerously close to the main road? It should have been positioned after the lies. Your explanation would be most welcome.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Blow Crescent, Coldblow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
